website_summaries.verdict: Earns the top spot on our shortlist by surpassing its competitors on features and quality. You won't find a shoe rack with more to offer.
pros: An attractive design that doubles as a bench
Sports a microfiber upholstered top, 2 shoe-storing tiers, and sturdy wooden frame
cons: It's heavy, and it's the most expensive model we reviewed
It doesn't have space for boots

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and very good price
customer_reviews.text: i bought this bench for my entrance since there is alway a lot of shoes around there. I ordered even though there are some other sellers with the same bench at a higher price and the reviews are mixed so I decided to take the risk and ordered it. Instructions are very basic but if you have ever put together a piece of furniture then it won't be hard since its common sense. After it was assembled it sat down and it feel very sturdy also doesn't look cheap. Love it. So far so good. By the way I put it together in less than 20 min.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.- UPDATE 6 Months after - Unstable
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. I use to have just a shoe stand with out the seat but always had to find a place to sit to take off my shoes. Now problem is solved. All in one. UPDATE: Very unstable after 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: SiscoKid

customer_reviews.title: I weigh 200 lbs and have two teens who also use it and it remains as sturdy as the day I put it together
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier than I expected for the price. I've had this in my entry way for several months now and use it daily as I put on my shoes. I weigh 200 lbs and have two teens who also use it and it remains as sturdy as the day I put it together. It was simple to assemble and I finished it in 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Addict

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as shown, sturdy and easy to assemble. Fits perfect for small needs locations. I had a 12" distance to fill between a wall and a front door sidelight. I did not want a large bench that would get bumped into. This is perfect. Fits 3-4 pairs of shoes on each rack depending on size, ours are all in the teen and adult range, there is also enough space underneath for flip flops. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in the entryway of a studio apartment
customer_reviews.text: I needed something small to hold my shoes and saw how cheap this was so I decided to give it a try. It fits perfectly by the front door and the bench on top is a great bonus as I don't have enough room for a chair nearby. Not sure about the weight limit but it feels sturdy holding my 150 pounds. I can squeeze some small boots on the top shelf but anything that gets close to your calf probably won't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Osterhage

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Looks OK but the microfiber seat cover always looks dirty. It's comfy to sit on but doesn't inspire confidence that it will hold up for a long time. I'm about 165 pounds and don't feel unsafe on it, but I find myself making very careful, deliberate moves while putting shoes on. Assembly wasn't difficult but somewhat more time consuming than expected for such a piece. If we get a couple years out of it I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: Sent back day 1.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all. A couple of the screw holes weren't drilled out all the way, very cheap material and I disassembled to send it back as soon as I put it together and tested it. I wouldn't expect it to last over 6 months if you use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not real wood, legs split when I tightened two screws too tight. No instructions, only pictures. There are four of the chrome legs that have to be on the outside placement for the outside screws to work. Does not tell you this, you have to look inside the chrome legs and find the ones with threads. I already had mine together before I realized this. Hard to put together - takes two for more ease in assembling. No buttons to cover holes left from screws - holes show - does not make a nice finish on the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Browning

customer_reviews.title: I really like this piece
customer_reviews.text: I really like this piece! I wanted something by the back door to put shoes on without them looking like they are "on display" like other shoe racks. The seat helps conceal the shoes somewhat. Plus it's nice to have a seat there while putting on your shoes. Assembly was fairly easy despite there not being any instructions, just a picture of all the parts and a diagram of where said parts go. Overall I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hall

customer_reviews.title: OK but won't last forever
customer_reviews.text: OK here's the deal, I got 15 months out of it and then it broke under my weight. I weigh about 210 lbs. This isn't something you'll pass on to your grandchildren, but maybe not a bad trade-off for 50 bucks, which is a mere bag of groceries or three restaurant lunches nowadays. While it lasted it was nice, had a clever and useful design. I will however buy a better-built bench to replace it. If you choose not to sit on it I suppose it'll last forever but that's kind of missing the point. For small people and skinny women I guess.
customer_reviews.author: K. Furr

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, handy addition to our living room.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice addition to our living room! We needed a shoe rack and I stumbled upon this one in my searches and I really loved the way it looked. So, we ordered it and I am so happy with it! The assembly was very easy-even for me and my not so handy boyfriend. It holds all of the shoes that we had strewn about in our entry way and it looks great with all the dark wood in the room. We get lots of compliments on it, too!
customer_reviews.author: Sara R. Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Just put it together this weekend and it spiffied the area by the front door right up. The chair is sturdy enough to accommodate two guests at one time, so no more need to do the one foot hop while putting on or taking off shoes. The cushion is covered with this microfiber type material and is pretty firm. Not uncomfortable to sit on, but definitely not a chair meant to stay on forever, which is perfect because that's not the point of this seat. The fiancee and I are happy with it. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Diego Cafe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: For the price ($40), you can't go wrong. It's the perfect size for an apartment entryway. It's not difficult to assemble together either. I'm a 36 year old female and used the enclosed tool and a Phillips screwdriver. I started by assembling one end and putting all the rods in then screwing the other end in then finally screwing the seat upside down (as recommended by a fellow reviewer). It took me about 40 minutes but that was me taking my time and letting my 3 year old son "help" me lol. It's a quality product and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cherijojo

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty ok
customer_reviews.text: I find this useful, and my only concern is that it might not hold a 200+ pounds adult, as the frame seems fairly lightweight. Looks about as pictured. Was relatively easy to put together, with the exception of putting the top on. There are no pre-drilled holes in the bottom of the top cushion, so you kind of have to wing it and just push down real hard with the screwdriver to get the screws to go in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Soltys

customer_reviews.title: Poorly manufactured -- couldn't assemble until we manually carved out a larger hole
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Was able to carve out a larger hole with a knife to be able fit the cross beam, so we were able to assemble the bench. It looks nice and is functional. Wish the manufacturing quality was higher so we didn't have to carve the wood. Was unable to assemble this item because one of the leg parts came with one badly cut hole (too small for metal cross beam). The rest of the holes fit the cross beams fine, but one was far too small and ended up cracking the leg when we tried to put the beam in.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brewer

customer_reviews.title: No more messed up hallway!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it is for stacking shoes, not for sitting on it for like 8 hours a day. It will break if you use it as a bench. Besides the disclaimer, It is very easy to assemble and looks very cool in my hall way. It can stock up to 8 pairs of shoes and I can also slide additional 3-4 pairs underneath the bottom rack. With this, I don't have to worry about messed up hallway with pile of shoes any more.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, medium sized, worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME! So perfect for our shoes! It sits nicely and neatly by the door in our kitchen. I couldn’t be more pleased with this purchase!! This stand is solid and clean lined. I’m glad i took the advice of the buzzfeed list and bought it! If you’re worried it’s cheaply made or rickety, it’s not. Go ahead and buy it i don’t think you’ll be disappointed. You’ll be thankful you can get rid of the pile of shoes by the door! I know i was! The only thing I’d change is the color of the cushion. But that can easily be unscrewed and recovered.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Looks like pic but breaks soon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item on April 7, 2018, and today is April 18, 2019, so I've had this item just over one year. It's lightweight and looks like the picture, but we have had it for only 12 months and it just broke yesterday. We have it in our entryway and use it for putting on and taking off shoes. With regular daily usage (no abuse, no throwing ourselves on it, a home with only 2 people), the main piece of wood right under the cushion cracked in half and the whole thing is now useless. Beware the low price and lack of sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Jyssica S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect organizer!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous organizer for shoes. It looks perfect in the hallway where we have a cluster of shoes. It has picture instructions so you have to think about it for a minute or two, but the assembly was easy and fast. I have a carpenter in the home so all he had to do was look at the pieces. Took him 10 minutes. It's very sturdy and light weight so it can be moved around easily. Cant go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WhenTheDustSells

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2016 and since I was moving in a month, I did not open it. I finally opened it to assemble about a month ago and the holes are drilled too far or too wide and I can get the screws to fit on one side. The holes are too big for screws. I can't get my money back, so I will be tossing this product in the garbage as it is useless. It was probably made in China. Please do not purchase this product. I don't know how it got so many good reviews. It is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne James

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This bench is narrow but still sturdy and comfortable enough to sit on while putting on shoes or boots. It holds six pairs of shoes as shown in the picture, though it would not be great for high heels or boots. The bench is not heavy at all and does not take up a lot of space. Because it is not heavy, it can slide when you get up, so I would recommend getting some sort of padding to protect your floors if you have hardwood or vinyl flooring. It was not hard to put together once I realized that there are two different types of metal poles.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Clark

customer_reviews.title: NO HOLES - DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: What a waste - no holes for bench and the side holes are drilled all the way through nothing to grip - it could have been beautiful and it's sad that all it is is fire wood due to poor drilling.
customer_reviews.author: ShelbyLive

customer_reviews.title: Working Well
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack/bench is working out well just inside the door from the garage. The padded bench is a handy spot to sit while putting on shoes. I appreciate the metal rails for the shoes so as shoes come in wet or muddy, the moisture won't ruin a wood or veneer finish. Assembly was fairly easy: just pay attention because only 4 of the 8 metal rails have threaded holes to be mounted in the black rack legs--the other four rails get sandwiched in between the black rack legs in the middle spots.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: We needed a quick smaller solution and this bench is ok. Once together it is sturdy. My hubby uses it at 225 lbs. Set it on its side to install the shoe pipes or go nuts. It uses a cheap, crappy tiny tool to tighten things. (Grumbling from the hubby) Not very stylish but works for now until I find someone over on Etsy to make something way better.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Does as is advertised. Especially like that you can actually fit shoes below it as well as on the two racks. Many other brands here on Amazon have a bar that wont allow shoes to be placed on floor. Not sure what the weight max is on this but do know that before we bought this my wife and I sat on it at a friends house and it held us both. Combined wt. is 310.
customer_reviews.author: l.F.

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I found it very difficult to put together. I was missing a couple of screws and, when I finished putting it together, I had screws/fasteners left over (not including the one I was missing) and no way that I could discern to fasten the bench seat to the top of the bench. I finally fastened it with double-sided carpet tape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bench does look like it would be very classic and fitting in any ...
customer_reviews.text: The seller NEEDS to state that you NEED a power drill to put the cushion on. I do not have a power drill to put the screws through the solid wood and I lack the strength to do it myself. We have a half assembled bench in our hallway now. Other than that, the rods are a bit difficult to assemble all at once. The bench does look like it would be very classic and fitting in any home.
customer_reviews.author: People4

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because although it's very cute and the cushion is super soft, the structure is not sound. I just got finished putting this together and as long as you sit and do not move at all, it may work but if there is any sway it pops and sounds like it will break. I would spend the extra money and get a structurally sound bench. Would not reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: katliz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: Love the way this stores shoes. Not quite strong enough for someone over 250 to sit on and be super sturdy, but very close. Easy to assemble and looks nice. Had to glue one small piece of wood that tried to brak off, but good for the price and faster than building my own.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: cushion slides every time I sit on it
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were extremely vague. I was able to put it together. But the last four screws that are supposed to hold the cushion on do NOT fit in the holes. So now the cushion slides every time I sit on it. Am I supposed to super glue them in? I think I would just like my money back
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T. Kunkel

customer_reviews.title: A nice shoe rack bench, instructions are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: A decent shoe rack, but after opening the box, I was a little upset at the lack of instructions. There is a single page info sheet showing where all the parts go, but there isn't any step by step instructions as to how to assemble it, or in what order to put it together. While this wasn't a problem for me, I could see other customers having trouble with it. The quality is okay, although I wouldn't put to much weight on the bench. While I'm a happy Amazon customer, this might be one of those items that should be examined in person at a store first before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Martoune

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good product, for the most part. Arrived timely and looks as in the picture; description is accurate. Works and looks good in entryway. I'm about 200#s and it seems sturdy. Unfortunately, it was not completely level after building so I had to use different sized chair leg scratch protector caps to balance it out. Make sure you don't overtighten the bolts. But, remember you aren't paying a couple hundred dollars for a piece of furniture. Very satisfied with this considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh145

customer_reviews.title: Broke during assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was assembling this product, and a the board split! A piece fell off! See the photo of it taped back on. It was completely assembled and I was tightening screws when it happened. Do not plan to send it back, because more assembly was required than the description led me to believe, and I don’t want to take it apart to send back. It’s also sturdy, so the damage is mostly cosmetic. But this product is not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat attractive, but very lightweight and flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly attractive, but it's also a very lightweight, flimsy product. The cushion is junk as well. It will probably hold a child, but it nearly broke when an average 5'10" adult sat on it to put his shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal for a Sturdy bench rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy bench that both, keeps your shoes off the floor (so roomba can sweep underneath), and gives a nice place to sit and put your shoes on. The ONLY thing missing from this bench is that it would be nice if the top seat part opened up to a seat compartment underneath to keep gloves or umbrellas or something. But, for the price, this was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow911

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe Rack/Bench
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife for Christmas. Really easy to put together. The cushion is really thick and comfortable. No more shoes piled under the bedroom window!! She loves it and that's all that matters. I recommend it if you're looking for a good shoe rack that you can also use as a bench. She has 8 pairs of shoes in it.
customer_reviews.author: D. MooneyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: This is a quick easy way to organize them
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee and I combined have too many shoes (mainly her) and nowhere to put them. We usually just kick them by the front door and clutter up. This is a quick easy way to organize them. We keep the shoes we use most on the bottom so they are easy to slide on. The seat makes it easier to put shoes on without sitting on the floor which I used to. The racks wont fit tall shoes like my work boots so I just put it right next to it. The assembly was easy but tedious.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This works great for right infront of the door. It is super cute, and small enough to not take up too much space. The only draw back is we did not receive any instructions to put it together. However it seemed like common since. It fits about six pairs of adult shoes with some space I between. The seat is suede and seems to attract dust or dander. We have a dog, so I am wondering if you will see the dog air (unsure at this moment.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: great purchase, set up quickly
customer_reviews.text: This shoe rack was exactly what I was looking for. It was pretty easy to put together, although the instructions didn't have any written parts, just pictures. We got it together within 20 minutes or so and it seems pretty stable. We can fit 8 pairs of shoes on there comfortably and it makes our foirer tidy! The bench isn't too wide but its enough to sit on comfortably with my 2 year old son to put on our shoes.
customer_reviews.author: KieraMae

customer_reviews.title: Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little boot bench. It's exactly as its pictured, though it's a little cheaply made. I love that it has two shelves for shoes underneath it. The only complaint would be that it didnt come with all the tools to assemble it. It came with the little wrench for the legs but not the screw driver to put the top on. It fits perfectly in the entry way. Overall it was a good buy, and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight product that you can sit on, but you can tell that it could potentially break easily if misused. Does a great job at keeping all of those shoes from being all over the front entrance to my boyfriend's house!
customer_reviews.author: Sonarkat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very pleased with this product. I am 235 pounds and my wife is 160 pounds. This shoe rack holds both of us at the same time without and complaints. Yes, I think I can break it. If I were to rock the shoe rack from side to side, or jump on it, The base of the seat and the legs will probably become unlatched. What else could you expect of a $50 shoe rack and seat? If you want something stronger, invest more money. However, I am shocked that I can get such a nice looking, easy to assemble, and reliable piece of furniture for so cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Rjones61

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now and it seems to be really good. Once built this is a lot stronger than I expected! Lining up the seat cushion was probable the hardest part because there are no pre-drilled holes to line up to, so you have to do your best to center it. I would highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Hobbes123

customer_reviews.title: really nice for the price and easy to recover the cushion ...
customer_reviews.text: really nice for the price and easy to recover the cushion with a staple gun and your choice of fabric. been great for our entryway fits my husbands size 11 shoes but the racks are to narrow for taller boots-made for lowtop tennis shoes and flats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago and liked it so much I recently bought a second one. They look very nice and provide both a place to sit and a place to store shoes. We have some large people in our family and this is study enough for them to sit on. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Champ

customer_reviews.title: Classy and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!!! We have been wanting something that would make the shoe corner of our house look decent (it drives me crazy to see shoes just laying around) and this was perfect!! It doubles as a bench and it goes with most of my furniture. It was easy to assemble and classy to look at. I didn’t really need any extra tools except for a screwdriver, in case anyone is wondering.
customer_reviews.author: A.L

customer_reviews.title: Still looks new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago to try and organize my life in the small apartment I lived it. I still have it. It has been a great investment especially when it come to keeping my shoes organized and after a year of constant use it still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Cleyde

customer_reviews.title: good chair
customer_reviews.text: All in all, it is a good chair, but when I installed it, comes to the final step to put the cushion on the bracket, it turns out that it is really hard to put the cushion perfectly alligned with the base. It should have some location markers for the screws for installation convenience.
customer_reviews.author: YS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy on used product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheaper one from the used section (+free shipping!) and it came in a large box, already assembled, no dents, dings, or anything noticeable. Looks great next to my other one in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Weaponmaster

customer_reviews.title: The product itself is not bad, but extremely bad assembly design and unclear assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is not bad, but extremely bad assembly design and unclear assembly instructions. You will spend a good 1 hour to assemble it, when it should not take more than 20 mins for a product as simple as this, because of the way all 8 rails and 2 bars are expected to align at the same time. Would have given it 4 star if otherwise
customer_reviews.author: PRASHANT SRINIVASAN

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Quick & easy assembly. No power tools. Place top cushion upside down on floor. Place wooden dowels into side pieces and slide ends on (Do not bolt together yet). Place this upside down on cushion and position so that it is square on all sides. Place four screws and apply a good downward force to get them to thread. Attach one side with two long bolts. Take off other side and set bench on end. Insert poles. Slide side piece into place (while poles are facing up). Finish bolting everything together and voila! Easy breezy, should take you about 10-15 minutes and you have a nice looking sturdy bench!
customer_reviews.author: SmilingAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Love this! I hated how messy the front door ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I hated how messy the front door area looked with all our shoes just left there. And my little ones aren’t the greatest at putting their shoes away back in their closets. I had to get something to look more organized & it for sure serves its purpose. Plus, the kids love sitting on the bench to put their shoes back on. Only issue I had was that it was a pain in the rear to assemble... instructions weren’t that great by any means. Besides that, I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: erikajas23

customer_reviews.title: Clearer instructions, but nice little bench.
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to assemble the bench this morning by myself, but recruited my boyfriend since it takes 2 people. There are no written instructions, just a parts sheet and a schematic of how the pieces fit together. It would have been helpful if the manufacturer indicated the initial steps to avoid having to disassemble and start over. We were surprised that the top is attached to the frame by 4 screws which take some muscle to connect. Overall, we are happy with the bench, it feels secure and strong enough for a 200-lb person to sit, and it looks nice in our entry.
customer_reviews.author: LindaLou

customer_reviews.title: no included instructions for the order to put it together
customer_reviews.text: disappointed that it came with NO instructions; only has a list of parts and quantities and a picture of what parts go where. it doesn't tell you in what order things should be done. had to take things apart 3 times after discovering a piece was supposed to be done before something else. took longer than it should because of that and ended up with extra screws because the place where they should have gone didn't fit. also not happy having to force screws in the top piece as there are no drilled holes in the bottom of the seat
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Use a good ratchet tool for assembly
customer_reviews.text: Found it on Amazon far cheaper than Wayfair. Was not worth the price on Wayfair. Was definitely worth it on Amazon (nearly half the price on WF). Use a good ratchet tool for assembly, take time to line everything up properly. I don't sit on, but the gf does. She's light. Had it for about a month, and it's held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: TikkiTokiTam

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution to Shoes All Over The Floor
customer_reviews.text: This bench looks and works very well. It's solved the issue of having our shoes piled up near the door in a little mound. Now we've got a little spot to store them and a place to sit to put them on and take them off. This thing seems a bit unstable while putting it together, but once everything is screwed securely in place it's perfectly stable to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to assemble. It looks good and fits nicely at the bottom of our stairs by the front door. My only complaint is it does not seem sturdy enough. I am hoping it lasts for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyGirl1213

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. One star is only because it was quite easy and fast to assemble. The last 4 screws that were meant for the cushion to be screwed onto the rack were way too long and would have punctured it. The wooden part of the rack is very flimsy and the whole thing shifts as you put your shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Fast assembly
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe rack! It was so easy to assemble! But the only thing I believe that it should come with is something to be able to bolt it to the wall if you have small children. My son has pulled it down over and over again, but we are looking for a way to bolt it to the wall. Otherwise the product itself is very good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Elegant in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Absolutely beautiful Extremely fast delivery All pieces included Cons: Need a PhD in mechanics to put it together Gave up after 2 hours Hired my handyman to do it - took him an hour
customer_reviews.author: bokuno

customer_reviews.title: Great little bench
customer_reviews.text: This little shoe rack/bench fits perfectly in our narrow entry way. We put a hard plastic boot tray under it to catch drips from wet or snowy shoes and boots. The bench was easy to assemble and seems quite sturdy. It handles 200+ pounds just fine. The microsuede cover has stayed clean and new looking despite regular use by a kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Runnerz

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench. I ordered it for the foyer so that i can store shoes and slippers to change into as i enter my house. I would recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: September

customer_reviews.title: Another one of “amazon’s choice” products a sever disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: No instructions. Flimsy. Costed $47.99 and seems much more reasonable at a $29.99 price point. I feel as though I severely overpaid, once again I have been suckered and snake-bitten by choosing an “amazon’s Choice” product. I have no idea how they choose, but at this point there must be some kick back involved because their “choices” are always a bad bet in my experience. Hope this helps any future buyers!
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Looks like we have to live with side screw not fastened
customer_reviews.text: The side screw doesn't screw in. Yes we put in the correct bars. Too much trouble to take it apart to return. Looks like we have to live with side screw not fastened. My lesson is to not buy from Amazon anything that difficult to return. Buy it from Walmart instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe rack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of furniture. Can hold up to 8 pairs of shoes. I am glad my shoes can now stay organized, sit in the home entrance and there’s a bench for people to sit and wear shoes.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: it's a great shoe rack for our condo
customer_reviews.text: We've had the shoe rack for about year now and it been working out great. I have to retighten some of the screws just once. Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.author: Merlyn

customer_reviews.title: Just as Expected
customer_reviews.text: This bench is serving its purpose well in my entrance. My music students sit on it to remove their shoes and they store them on the racks. I was warned by other reviewers that there were no clear instructions, but my 12-year-old grandson interpreted them as though there were words on the page. It took us about 20 minutes to put it together. The only glitch was that we didn't pay attention to the fact that some of the rods were made just for the screws, while others were not. It all worked out. It is strong and solid and holds even my heaviest adult students.
customer_reviews.author: Chayman Simms

customer_reviews.title: Read the review
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality. Absolute pain in the rear to put it together. I wear size 12 shoes and can fit 3 pairs on each shelf. Boots will not fit in this item. You Can slide sandals underneath it. Its smaller than I thought but I bought it for my kids to sit on so I'm happy. I Hope it holds up. Very cheap parts.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy spender

customer_reviews.title: Great entryway bench!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 6 weeks ago. The bench was super easy to assemble. The shoe rack easile accomodates 6 pairs of shoes ans has space underneath for slippers. I placed it in y entryway and regularly sit on it when I take my shoes off and/or put them on. I weigh about 200 and find the bench very sturdy and stable.
customer_reviews.author: TeamLCDG

customer_reviews.title: Terrible packaging - loose styrofoam everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was terrible - loose styrofoam all over the place and bag with screws was wide open so we had to dump the whole box out. Ended up loosing two of the rings. Looked like a mouse had gotten in there. Product is great however and now that's it's set up and the styrofoam bits are finally off the floor (that was fun) we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: KPeters13

customer_reviews.title: Was surprised as to the quality once put together.
customer_reviews.text: My expectations were not high with this item. The steel bars that your shoes sit on keep the piece completely solid. I put it together in about 20 minutes. Took longer to unpack the items than to put it together. A previous review mentioned that they used a screw gun to screw the seat to the frame. This is what you should do. I did the same thing and it worked well. Did not have to pre-drill.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Bill

customer_reviews.title: Strudy and useful
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is compact and small enough for a small space but still has so much room for shoes and a place to sit down for a second.
customer_reviews.author: Krystina Clemons

customer_reviews.title: Still a nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Putting the base together with the frame/legs was a problem. The little screws provided and no pre-drilled holes makes is difficult to assemble. Still a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Ordering Rookie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Organizes well
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this piece. The one complaint I have is that the shoe storage underneath does not fit larger shoes or high top shoes very well. The spacing seems to be a little off but its nothing I cant live with.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: So hard to put together, especially when trying to get the seat part stabilized with the screws. I think I might just use the shoe part since that’s not a safety issue. Hope it’ll hold up for that at least, I wish I’d read the one stars. It would have saved me money and heartache. Too big to try to return.
customer_reviews.author: Writer'sAnnonymous

customer_reviews.title: a bit annoying to assemble
customer_reviews.text: a bit annoying to assemble - but once done - it looks very nice and also during winter season - can't use it for boots unfortunately - but overall happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: LILIREIGN

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material holds several pairs
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the hallway so that my husband n kids to put there working n outside shoes there instead of coming inside with dirty shoes, holds plenty of pairs very sturdy n spacious to sit on n put on or take off shoes love it
customer_reviews.author: Olvera

customer_reviews.title: Very practical and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and works great! Great space for organizing my shoes and is strong enough to hold two people (I haven't tried 3 yet).
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Please listen  IMPOSSIBLE TO PUT TOGETHER!!
customer_reviews.text: Please listen. Don't buy. ABSOLUTELY IMPOSSIBLE TO PUT TOGETHER. WHAT A NIGHTMARE. AND,if there is a secret, the company is holding on to it. Poor instructions.
customer_reviews.author: M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: It matches the coat shelf that was a suggested buy with product perfectly. It is super comfy and very sturdy. This shoe rack can hold a lot of shoes also. I would completely buy this again and it wasn't even that hard to put together.
customer_reviews.author: alexandria cadime

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and functional. Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this show rack to keep the shoes we use the most at hand and organized. Great choice! It fits 6-8 pairs, depending on the size and the type of shoes. It has to be assembled but it's pretty easy, it takes 15-20min and the instructions are pretty straight forward. The only thing you will need that's not included is a screwdriver, only for the final step. Once assembled it's light and sturdy, good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Was really easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Was really easy to put together. I like the room to put shoes on it and its holding up well. Not the sturdiest piece of furniture we own but it is enought to support us at about 250lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective. ..No Quality Assurance...should have shipped this product/shame
customer_reviews.text: It was defective, unable to assemble, the holes were predrilled in the wrong spots. TO HEAVY FOR ME TO LIFT AND MAKE TIME TO SEND Back...garbage and I lost money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Shoe storage
customer_reviews.text: Easy storage for our shoes in the living room and it looks nice too didn't like that all the poles had to be put in before adding the one side made it a little difficult to put together but otherwise good buy also price was a bit steep for material
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in our hallway and the shelve are far enough apart to accommodate wedges and heels or booties. It was a little difficult to put together so but I was able to do it on my own, it would have been super easy with two people.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Olafson

customer_reviews.title: The bench is great once put together
customer_reviews.text: The bench is great once put together. It is very sturdy and looks great. Holds 6 pairs of shoes comfortably. The metal bars should be easy to clean. Putting it together is a pain because you have to align 8 bars to fit in 8 holes simultaneously. I found this was easiest done by fastening everything to one side, laying that side on the floor with the bars sticking up vertically, and then putting the other side on top. I used an electric driver so drilling holes into the top wasn't necessary. I can't justify taking off a star for 10 mins of annoyance considering how great this bench is for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First of all, I thought that I wouldn't be ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I thought that I wouldn't be needing an extra tool to assemble this bench. Until now the top cushion is not attached to the body, because there isn't a hole for the screw to go into, to connect them together. But the design and size is just right for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Sitti Sahara Pandain

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to put together. I can fit 5-7 kids shoes on one shelf. It would be nice if it was up a little higher, then I can put shoes underneath the bottom shelf, but not a big deal. I can put flip flops/sandals underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Ive have the bench for a fews months now and its held up quite nicely so far
customer_reviews.text: It was a little bit of a pain setting up but part of that was my fault. Ive have the bench for a fews months now and its held up quite nicely so far. The cushion is still soft and firm enough for comfortable sitting. Overall a very good purchase, I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect, my friend bought one from TJ Maxx and I loved the idea of keeping all the shoes in one place close to the door, since I don't allow entry without removal of shoes. While searching Amazon I found this one which also features a seat which could not be any more perfect. I put it together easily and am very pleased with the sturdiness while putting shoes on.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany L Steil

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, highly functional and holds more shoes than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit smaller than I thought, but works very well and feels super sturdy. It would have been easier to build with two people I think, as lining up all of the rods at once takes some practice/juggling. That said, I use it for THREE rows of shoes, putting my flip-flop types underneath, and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: R Armand

customer_reviews.title: Love this little bench
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little bench shoe rack. It does perfect in my entry way area of my home. Oddly enough it matches my couch as if they were made to go together. It was easy to put together and it's very sturdy. It doesn't feel weak at all.
customer_reviews.author: DimplesPalmer24

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé and I had been looking for something that wasn’t just a random show rack. It’s nice, I would have preferred wood instead of the metal but it works. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because the metal bars are a little difficult to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, no surprises
customer_reviews.text: I’m a firm believer in “you get what you pay for”, so don’t expect this to be some phenomenal quality product. I’m giving it 5 stars because it exceeded my expectations of a product at this price. T didn’t break under my weight (205lbs), and the shoes fit easily. It works for what it’s supposed to be. Good job people who make this!
customer_reviews.author: Kooshball

customer_reviews.title: Great bench size, sturdy and price!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the location I needed it for, easy to put together and holds a good 6 or 7 pairs of adult shoes. Win/win!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but with a significant flaw.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe rack itself is very nice, but assembling it was a huge pain, particularly because there is no good way to attach the top to the frame of the rack. This is a major assembly flaw. I wound up using Gorilla Glue to hold it in place since the screws they provide were essentially impossible to attach the top unless you use a power drill.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Privitera

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I bought fabrics and used a staple gun to reupholster the top before I assembled. It even fits my husbands huge shoes.
customer_reviews.author: RogueLeader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, looks good and is pretty sturdy. Some people had trouble putting it together from what i read in the comments but its truly really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lab K.

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe organizer
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe organizer. It looks so much better than the standard show organizers out there, it looks great in my entryway. Very happy with this purchase, I only wish it had room for a few more pairs of shoes (i.e. I wish it was a little longer). Highly recommend though!
customer_reviews.author: Bellz

customer_reviews.title: A super looking bench
customer_reviews.text: As described and is a really pretty bench! Instructions are in photo format. Not so easy to put together so be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: steelwidow

product_meta.title: Black / Chocolate Micro Fabric Shoe Rack Storage Organizer & Hallway Bench
product_meta.description: Comfort and functionality combine to shape this beautiful black/chocolate bench. This bench provides extra seating, valuable storage space for shoes and has a durable wooden frame and showcases a chocolate microfiber upholstery.
feature_bullets: Black / Chocolate Micro Fabric Shoe Rack Organizer & Hallway Bench.
Can be used as a shoe organizer, bedroom and hall way bench with microfiber fabric upholstery seat cover on a black wood base.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,036 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
